alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:06PM EDT until May 09 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maryland...Virginia... Potomac River at Point of Rocks affecting Loudoun and Frederick Counties. For the Potomac River...including Paw Paw, Hancock, Dam Number Five, Shepherdstown, Harpers Ferry, Point of Rocks, Edwards Ferry, Little Falls...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Potomac River at Point of Rocks. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Water approaches structures at the Brunswick campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.3 feet, or 5.7 feet below flood stage. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 18.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.1 feet on 03/13/1817. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sun Sun Sun Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 2AM 8AM 2PM Stg Time Date Potomac River Point of Rocks 16.0 10.3 Sat 8 pm 13.2 15.6 17.8 18.1 8pm Sun &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM EDT.
